poem:
"Of Scandals, Fear, and Late-night Humour"

Trump's secrets, now uncoiled, throb in the light,
Colbert's late-night chuckle cuts through the spite.
Three weeks of hush-money, courtroom plight,
Thank heavens for relief from this bitter fight.
Fake fears of foul play in the Florida bite,
A reprieve, we seek, from this incessant blight.
Oh, to speak of something else, oh what might...
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Stephen Colbert on Trump’s classified documents trial: ‘Exactly much worse than we could’ve thought’ Late-night hosts talked Donald Trump’s classified documents scandal and fearmongering that the FBI’s 2022 Mar-a-Lago raid was an assassination attempt. Stephen Colbert “We’ve been talking about Donald Trump’s hush-money trial for three weeks now,” said Stephen Colbert on Wednesday’s Late Show, “and I for one am thrilled that he’s not in court today, so that we can talk about anything else!". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Stephen Colbert on Trump’s classified documents trial: ‘Exactly much worse than we could’ve thought’ Late-night hosts talked Donald Trump’s classified documents scandal and fearmongering that the FBI’s 2022 Mar-a-Lago raid was an assassination attempt. Stephen Colbert “We’ve been talking about Donald Trump’s hush-money trial for three weeks now,” said Stephen Colbert on Wednesday’s Late Show, “and I for one am thrilled that he’s not in court today, so that we can talk about anything else!
